fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring a custom field, there are options for multiple contexts to allow for the custom field to behave differently in different projects or issue types. If you enable a second context, the default global context is now ignored. When using the "Where is my field" link, it shows:
{quote} The field 'CUSTOM FIELD' is not configured in scope of the project 'PROJECT' and issue type 'TYPE' 
To solve this issue, go to 'CUSTOM FIELD' configuration page and add it to the scope{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field (tested with single select)
# Open the field configuration
# Add new contexts with different options for a specific issue type
# Go to a screen that contains the field based on the default context

h3. Expected Results

See the default context on the screen (with the new context showing in the corresponding screen) 
h3. Actual Results

The field is not included in the default context (new context shows as expected)

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Enabling a second context for a custom field causes the default behavior to no longer function.

fields.description: As an administrator, I believe it would be very useful to be able to move issues between federated instances of Jira. This would add to the flexibility of federated instances and would allow users to have separate instances but still be able to collaborate easily when needed by moving work between teams who operate out of different instances.
fields.summary: Ability to Move Issues Between Federated Instances

fields.description:
Currently the only way to see if a mail server's connection has failed is to go into the connection and test it.  Because our mail accounts have routine password expiration, we would like to have some sort of notification that a given mail server has failed to connect (whether for incorrect credentials, inability to reach the mail server, or otherwise).

 

It would also be useful to have some sort of status indicator on the Incoming/Outgoing Mail pages to see at a glance which connections are fine and which have failed without a re-connection afterwards.
fields.summary: Mail Servers - Notify On Failed Connection
Syntax highlighting should include ASM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JPG file format attachment unable to download from preview screen on Firefox
h3. Environment

Browser - Mozilla Firefox & IE11

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on .JPG file format attached to an issue  [^cp1.PNG]
 # It will open a preview and click on the download icon (arrow) [^cp2.PNG]
 # The image will be opened in the browser itself [^cp3.PNG]

h3. Expected Results

The image should be downloaded upon clicking "Download" tab.
h3. Actual Results

The image was not downloaded and remained open in the tab.
h3. Notes

Jira is passing the header as "Content-Disposition: inline" to the browser

[^cp4.PNG]
h3. Workaround
 * Right click and select "Save Image as" to save on Mozilla 
 * Using Chrome, Safari and Edge
fields.summary: Image attachments unable to download from preview screen on Firefox and IE11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Restoring backup from Jira Cloud into Jira Server is changing "Manage Sprints" permission in all Permission Schemes.
Project Role "Administrators" is added to all schemes and other Roles are removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new Project Role in Jira Cloud
# Add this new Role to the Manage Sprints permission in any permission scheme
# Create backup to Server
# Restore backup

h3. Expected Results
Project permissions remain as they were in Cloud

h3. Actual Results
"Administrators" Project Role is added to the Manage Sprints permission
Other Project Roles are removed from Manage Sprints

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Manage Sprints permission changed on migration from Cloud to server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
VersionHealthCheck pre-upgrade fails due to version string "Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production\nWith the Partitioning option" :

{code:java}
http-nio-8080-exec-24 ERROR anonymous 648x14x1 8w4xt 10.112.237.250 /secure/SetupDatabase.jspa [c.a.j.h.checks.database.SupportedDatabaseVersionHealthCheck] SupportedDatabaseVersionHealthCheck is unable to run because: the version string retrieved from the database does not seem to contain a version number (version string: "Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production\nWith the Partitioning option"). This probably means the database is not supported 
{code}

h3. Environment
Jira 8.3.0
DB Oracle 12c R1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.3.0 and connect it to DB Oracle 12c R1 64bit With the Partitioning option enabled
 # During VersionHealthCheck the above error is thrown out

h3. Expected Results

According to the documentation Oracle 12c R1 is supported and there are no limitation related to the Partitioning option enabled

h3. Actual Results
Health check code uses the folowung Java regex pattern:
{code}
^.*?(\d+\.\d+)\.\d+\.\d+.*?
{code}
so it doesn't expect the oracle version string to span more than 1 line.

Actual string is:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
"Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production
With the Partitioning option"
{code}
* the 2nd string could be different

h3. Workaround

The only option the customer would have is to drop the Partitioning option of Oracle so that the version string becomes a single line and Jira is able to work with it.
fields.summary: VersionHealthCheck fails due to version string contains new line character

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Set up an instance using the 8.2 version

2. Set up a sprint with enough issues that the Sprint Report generated by Jira would have more than one page when printed.

3. Try to print the report from either Firefox or Chrome.

4. Expected result: Multiple pages would print.

5. Actual result: Only the first page of the report prints.

Second Scenario:

1. Use Chrome or Firefox and attempt to use the browser's print to PDF or save as PDF functionality.

2. Expected result: The full sprint report saves as a PDF

3. Actual result: Only the first page of the report saves.
fields.summary: Error when printing Sprint Report

h3. Environment
 * Jira 8+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Hit Create issue button
 # In visual mode, add panel to description field
 # Observe bad CSS

h3. Expected Results

Panel would render correctly before submitting issue.
h3. Actual Results

The panel is applied to the field, but looks incorrect:

!panel_error.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The panel renders correctly once the issue is submitted or edited.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a panel to description/comment/text field shows bad CSS applied on page.

fields.description:
A recent [Nessus scan|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Subresource_Integrity] found a vulnerability in one of our products that were using a Jira issue collector as a Feedback mechanism. It was marked as vulnerable because the integrity of the javascript for trigger-style in issue collector was not checked. 

The notable exploit of this is attack is at BritishAirways.com https://www.riskiq.com/blog/labs/magecart-british-airways-breach/. 

h4. Suggestion

* Is there a way to configure the generated issue collector URLs with integrity and crossorigin=anonymous attributes (SRI)? See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Subresource_Integrity for reference on SubResourceIntegrity (SRI).
fields.summary: Integrate SubResourceIntegrity to issue collectors URL

fields.description: A lot of systems are on closed and isolated networks and do not have Internet access to view documentation online for an upgrade or other change in the environment. It would be good if along with the online documentation for upgrades or even Security Advisories, was released a PDF version of such documents to be printed more easily.
fields.summary: Documentation in PDF

fields.description:

I tried finding a feature request through the support site and was able to find anything to upvote.

 
 * [https://octopus.com/docs/deployment-process/issue-tracking/jira]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/modules/deployment/]
fields.summary: Add Deployment module / Support for Octopus Deploy Plugin to Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Instance Health Checks (ATST) in German System Language, looking at the "Supported Database" section, it will state that the database used is not supported (Das Modell und die Version Ihrer Datenbank werden nicht unterstützt), despite the green checkmark. However, should the System language is changed to English, the message states that the database is supported. This causes misleading messages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that ATST installed is version 1.18 or higher
# Ensure that the database used supported
# Change the System language to German
# Go to *Administration > System > Troubleshooting and Support Tools > Instance Health Checks*
# Check under *Supported Platforms > Supported Database*

h3. Expected Results
The message should state that the database is supported.

h3. Actual Results
The message states that the database is not supported. This will still persist even if the User Profile Language is set to English.
 !DBSupported.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Atlassian Troubleshooting & Support Tools (ATST) will display misleading message in German for Supported Database

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users who don't have "Browse Project" permission wouldn't be able to view/access the project. In this context, the users should also not be able to select the project when creating issues via the 'Create' Header button.

h3. Suggested Solution
When users are not granted the "Browse Project" permission, they should not be able to create issues for that project via the 'Create' Header button.

h3. Workaround 
Revoke the "Create Issue" permission
fields.summary: User should not be able to create issues for projects they don't have access too

fields.description:
Whenever you have multiple projects associated AND you have statuses that need to be changed to be compatible or any other change that requires changes to issues, the workflow scheme ID is incremented to a higher number.

h3. Workaround
The only way to avoid this behavior is to avoid the conditions that trigger the increment of the ID. These include but may not be limited to the conditions noted previously.  Based on your use case, you could likely circumvent this by having a single workflow scheme per project. (likely not feasible).
fields.summary: When editing a Workflow Scheme that has multiple projects associated AND also statuses that need to be changed to be compatible, its ID is incremented to a higher number

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Within Jira's footer page, the link to www.atlassian.com is placed with HTTP instead of HTTPS. 

h3.  Suggestion
Change all Atlassian links from HTTP to HTTPS. 

As security scanners might get HTTP links within HTML hyperlinks, they might show Atlassian websites as insecure.

h3. Notes
Atlassian website redirects the traffic to HTTPS even though we're accessing it as "http://www.atlassian.com"
fields.summary: Have all atlassian links with HTTPS instead of HTTP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching for Shared Dashboards from JIRA Administration -> System -> Shared Dashboards, if no result is found, JIRA displays a technical message (*{{/searchEmptyMessageKey}}*) instead of a user-friendly one.

h3. Environment
Affecting JIRA 7.12.x and above.

Not affecting JIRA 7.11.x or below.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to JIRA Administration -> System -> Shared Dashboards
 # Search using a keyword that won't return any result

h3. Expected Results
JIRA displays this message:
{panel}(i) Your search criteria did not match any dashboards.{panel}

h3. Actual Results
JIRA displays this message:
{panel}(i) /searchEmptyMessageKey{panel}

h3. Notes
# This is just a visual issue. The above message literally means there's no result.
# Shared Filters is not affected.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Shared Dashboards shows /searchEmptyMessageKey when no result is found

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira Software, the original estimate for an Epic(In the Epic Burndown) can be changed during a sprint if the stories within the epic change. The problem is that issue split after the start of an Epic are removed from the point totals of all sprints back to the start of the Epic and that the newly created issues from the split are treated as scope increase while the points removed from the source issue are not reflected as offsetting scope decrease for a net 0 effect.

The suggestion is to enable an option so the original doesn't change after the sprint start regardless of the changes in the Epic's stories.
fields.summary: Option for the original estimate not change after sprint start.(Epic Burndown)

fields.description:
h3. Jira says that the JQL is incorrect even is it correct one.

Jira said that the JQL is incorrect if you add brackets "()" to the last logic part of your nested query. If you add brackets to the others statements/part of the JQL there won't be any error.
h3. Current behaviour:

Correct JQL:
 !image-2019-07-25-11-13-12-896.png! 
 Incorrect JQL:
 !image-2019-07-25-11-10-48-063.png!
h3. Expected behaviour:

Both JQL should be correct - (/)

h3. Workaround
Remove brackets in your last nested statement.
fields.summary: JQL Spellchecker did not accept bracket in last nested logic statement

fields.description:
We have the following use case:

We are Using Jira and have 2 Confluence instances (A and B) linked with application links. Now in the Jira activity stream the activity of both Confluence instances are shown. As an Administrator I want to disable the activity stream for a specific linked application (confluence instance B) for all users. Because in this Confluence instance B nobody has a user and when a user creates a dashboard with activity stream gadget in JIRA, the activity of Confluence B is always active.

With this active activity the performance of Jira is worse. Everytime a user opens a dashboard with activity stream active Confluence B activity in Filters, the activity stream gadgets need up to 15 seconds to load. When the user disable the Confluence B activity in Filters, the gadget loads in 3 seconds.
fields.summary: Ability to disable complete application link activity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, if no fields are specified when searching via REST, all fields are returned. This could be slow and also adds extra overhead to the system, in some cases, a specific Custom Field could significantly slow down the response (see JRASERVER-68602)

h3. Suggested Solution
* Introduce the configurable list of default Custom Fields (CF) returned by REST search
* Return the list of default CF if no fields are specified
**  unless it was explicitly requested to return all fields 

h3. Workaround 
When performing REST api searches, ensure to specify the fields you need. 
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
{base_url}/rest/api/2/search?jql=text%20~%20task\&fields=summary,description,reporter,assignee
{code}
fields.summary: As a Jira user I would like have configurable list of default Custom Fields returned by REST search

fields.description:
We no longer use gravatar and therefore have 13 avatar files per user (we have ~ 880000 users and ~590,000 unique files) saved to {{data/avatars}} in a flat directory . We can’t even run an {{ls}} or {{find}} on that directory (we gave up after 6.5 hours). Only specialized tools like fpart are even able to traverse the directory, which takes ~42 minutes. This has caused us some pain with creating backups of our service, which means we are unable to reguarly backup avatars AND hit RPO targets.

Confluence handles this by having hierarchal avatar storage which is complicated, but effective ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/hierarchical-file-system-attachment-storage-704578486.html])

In addition, we have noticed that user initials avatars are rendered into 13 unique PNG files per user (small to very large), which uses ~90kb of disk space, which seems like an inefficient compared to styling via CSS client side or storing one SVG per user.

Are there any plans for implementing a similar (or better) storage mechanism for avatars in Jira? 
h3. Workaround:

Do not backup avatars.
fields.summary: Avatar files are stored as 13x PNGs for each user in a flat directory structure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Parameters for Jira Agile's REST endpoints are case sensitive, while most of Jira's REST endpoints are not.  This inconsistency causes incorrect results and usage.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have multiple projects/boards in Jira.
** In my case, one of my projects is SSP and on a scrum board
# Request the following endpoint: http://localhost:8080/rest/agile/1.0/board?projectKeyOrId=SSP
** Notice that the proper results are returned
# Request the following endpoint: http://localhost:8080/rest/agile/1.0/board?projectkeyorid=SSP
** Note that I simply set all letters to lowercase in "projectKeyOrId"
** Notice that all results are returned

h3. Expected Results
REST parameter will be recognized regardless of letter casing

h3. Actual Results
The REST parameter does not take effect and all results are shown.  There is also no errors to indicate the that parameters are not recognized, so users will not know that this failed.

h3. Notes
This was found with the "projectKeyOrId" parameter, but the same behaviour also occurred with "type" and probably others as well.

h3. Workaround
Ensure to double check the casing in the parameters to ensure they match the REST documentation exactly.
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/7.3.1/
fields.summary: Jira Agile REST parameters are case sensitive
The "Edit Issue" REST API endpoint example has some invalid JSON

fields.description:
Users that have been added to the admin group do not have access to administrative screens prior to project creation.   Admins are unable to perform configuration changes, or project import, until a "dummy" account is created, or as the local default admin.  For some enterprises, the infrastructure admin, application admin, and project admins may be different users.
 * Default system administrator, created during installation, is the only local user.
 * User Directory connected to corporate Active Directory.
 * Subset of users added to jira-administrators group.
 * Admin user is unable to access system administration screens (i.e cog icon is missing) until at least one project is created in JSD.
 * In order to workaround this issue:
 ** The default system account has to be used
 ** A ‘dummy’ project has to be created and then later removed
fields.summary: As a Jira Service Desk (JSD) user with administrative privileges, I would like the ability to access administration screens prior to creating a projects in JSD.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When running a DC instance, the Jira Startup / splash screen does not appear. Instead, Tomcat appears to refuse connections altogether until the node has started up. 

This impacts troubleshooting / load balancer configuration - ideally one should be able to monitor the {{/status}} endpoint of a node to keep it out of the pool during startup, but still hit that node directly to monitor startup progress. A more complex LB configuration would then allow only proxying users to running nodes, but during a _full_ restart when all nodes are down, then proxying users any nodes that are starting rather than just 503'ing. This is currently not possible.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a new standalone instance - run through the setup and choose the default options (built in DB, etc)
 # Apply a DC license, but do not configure DC yet
 # After setup is complete, restart and confirm that you see the splash screen
 # Stop the instance. create $JIRA_HOME/shared, and create a cluster.properties file with {{jira.node.id=node1}} and {{jira.shared.home=/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/shared}}
 # Start the instance once more, and confirm that the splash screen no longer appears. Tomcat will refuse connections until the node is ready / finished startup

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Splash screen does not appear in DC mode

h3. Issue Summary

# Once they are both up and running, shut down {{node2}} and change the nodeID {{node1}}.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should prevent the second {{node1}} from joining the cluster.

h3. Actual Results

You are able to start the second {{node1}} and access it directly. There will be a single record in the database regarding {{node1}}, which will have the IP value as the IP of the last node with that ID that joined the cluster.

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Issue Summary

Because of the [latest changes that occurred in Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/user-avatars-are-suddenly-missing-969533903.html], User Avatars now reside outside the Cloud database. They are located in {{id.atlassian.com}}.

For this reason:

Add a supported method to migrate user avatars from Cloud to Server.
fields.summary: Add a supported method to migrate user avatars from Cloud to Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

There are several issues in our official document related to the Cloud to Server migration.


*Issue 1*

There are 2 different pages explaining how to perform the migration:
- one that resides in the Cloud space: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-776636236.html
- one that resides in the Server space: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html 

The documentation that resides in Cloud is incomplete and is missing some steps that are in the documentation Server, therefore adds confusion.

*Issue 2*

Because of the [latest changes that occurred in Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/user-avatars-are-suddenly-missing-969533903.html], User Avatars now reside outside the Cloud database: they are located in {{id.atlassian.com}}

For this reason:
- user avatars are not included in the Cloud backup
- user avatars can't be migrated from Cloud to Server

h3. Suggested solution

# Remove the migration documentation from the Cloud space, so that we only keep the one from the Server space which is more complete and not missing any step
# In the documentation that resides in Server, let's add something like this (please reformulate if necessary) in the *Limitations* section:
{quote}
Due to the [recent changes that took place in Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/user-avatars-are-suddenly-missing-969533903.html], User Avatars now reside in id.atlassian.com and therefore are not included in the Cloud backup and cannot be migrated to Server
{quote}
fields.summary: Update the documentation about the migration from Cloud to Server (avatar/gravatar)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Between option for date fields in Basic search filters the second date incorrectly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Issue navigator
 # In the Basic search, add a datetime field to the search (like the Created field) and use the option "Between".
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The search returns all the issues that are between the "start" and "finish" date.
h3. Actual Results

The results include all issues from the "start" date but do not include the issues from the "finish" date, only issues from one day before. For example, if we search using 5 Jun to 17 Jun, the search includes issues from 5 Jun but not the one from 17 Jun: !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

If we move to Advanced search, it seems that the problem is that the date is not including the time, which may mean that the time is set as 00:00. From tests, it seems that adding the time as 23:59 would solve the issue
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workarounds

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 * To add one more day to the basic Between search.
 * To use advanced search
fields.summary: Using the Between option for date fields in Basic search filters the second date incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Asynchronous cache replication can cause extra overhead in case of large number cache updates and many stale nodes.

h3. Environment
* Jira DC  
* A large number of stale nodes (see JRASERVER-42916)
* Plugin (code) generating a large number of cache update events, eg reaching 2000 messages/min.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a URL which produces the cache update event while computing the business logic
#* Eg. #* {{/rest/servicedesk/1/<PRJ>/webfragments/sections/sd-queues-nav,servicedesk.agent.queues,servicedesk.agent.queues.ungrouped}}
# Measure response time and number of replication events

h3. Expected Results
Performance doesn't degrade with a number of old nodes. 

h3. Actual Results
Performance degrades with a number of old stale nodes. 

* While taking thread dumps you can see a lot of threads busy in the following stack:
{noformat}
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.io.RandomAccessFile.writeBytes(Native Method)
	at java.io.RandomAccessFile.write(RandomAccessFile.java:512)
	at com.squareup.tape.QueueFile.writeHeader(QueueFile.java:184)
	at com.squareup.tape.QueueFile.add(QueueFile.java:321)
	- locked <0x00000003ce9b43e0> (a com.squareup.tape.QueueFile)
	at com.squareup.tape.FileObjectQueue.add(FileObjectQueue.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.tape.TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue.add(TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheOpQueueWithStats.add(LocalQCacheOpQueueWithStats.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager.addToQueue(LocalQCacheManager.java:370)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager.addToAllQueues(LocalQCacheManager.java:354)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator.replicateToQueue(LocalQCacheReplicator.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator.replicatePutNotification(LocalQCacheReplicator.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.AbstractJiraCacheReplicator.notifyElementUpdated(AbstractJiraCacheReplicator.java:123)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.internalNotifyElementUpdated(RegisteredEventListeners.java:228)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.notifyElementUpdated(RegisteredEventListeners.java:206)
...
{noformat}
* From client's case, we saw 15 - 20% of all threads doing {{replicateToQueue}}

h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
Clean-up old node data manually, see JRASERVER-42916
fields.summary: Asynchronous cache replication can cause extra overhead in case of large number cache updates and many stale nodes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Please Note the current Documentation Inconsistency BUG about the expected default behavior when a Boolean is used:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69649

Clarification Reference from Basic Search documentation found here: ["Search syntax for text fields"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html], Noting that the expected default behavior of not using a boolean value between two terms is the "AND" operator not the "OR" operator as both variations are currently listed in the document and the following statement is true:
{quote}
"If you combine multiple terms without specifying any Boolean operators, they will be joined using AND operators."
{quote}

However when doing a Query that has two terms missing an Operator nested inside a Group the behavior defaults to a "+" rather than an "AND"
EXE using a very simple text search:
in the Text field search for *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)*  noting that compound word is actually two separate terms where Term 1 = "compound" and term 2 = "word" per definition criteria of a Term:
{quote}
There are two types of terms: single terms (e.g. "hello") and phrases (e.g. "hello dolly")
{quote}

This would be consider a Phrase if placed in quotes, as there are no quotes the default  conjunction operator should be "AND" however we are seeing behavior similar to the "+" Operator unless explicitly flagged as "AND" or as "OR" in the query.

h3. Environment
Cloud & Server affected Tested and verified behavior on current Cloud version and server version in the range 7.2, 7.13, 8.0, & 8.2

If using Jira cloud See corresponding Cloud bug Report here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72542

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Requests containing only one of the following in each issues Description and any other combination that you want to verify against:
{quote}
test word
test compound test word
{quote}
# Run the search using Control search
{code}
test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)
{code}
#run the search using verification search
{code}
test (singleTerm OR term OR compound AND word)
test (singleTerm OR term OR compound + word)
{code}


h3. Expected Results
Expected that control query *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)*  and the "AND" test query *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound AND word)* would return the same result set which would be the issue containing "test compound test word"

h3. Actual Results
both text combinations are returned and this is the same result set as the "+" operator test query

h3. Notes
It appears to be a conflict of the double AND application on the distributive action to the nested query inside the (grouping), as the portion "test()" is technically triggering the default conjunction operator as a "test AND ()" with the additional distribution of the alternate default conjunction operator portion "AND word" making it "test AND AND word" causing some conflict in logic at this point,  

As an additional visual exe manual distribution of operators in the string *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)* to a advanced query should look like this:
{code}
text ~ (test AND single term) OR (test AND term) OR (test AND compound) AND (test AND word)
{code}
BUT is actually being treated as:
{code}
text ~ (test AND single term) OR (test AND term) OR ((test AND compound) AND (test AND word))
{code}
OR
{code}
text ~ (test AND single term) OR (test AND term) OR (test AND compound) + (test AND word)
{code}


h3. Workaround
First NOTE the "AND" is expected not the "OR" per the linked documentation BUG, so use the "AND" operator variable Manually rather than relying on the query to use a whitespace to default to the default conjunction operator "AND"  especially when used in nested queries to verify the correct search operator is being used.
OR 
Rely on Advanced Search queries as defined in:
- [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-939938733.html]
fields.summary: Basic Search default Boolean inside a Group is incorrectly mapped to "+" operator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Documentation for Basic Search:
* [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver074/search-syntax-for-text-fields-921472949.html]

Quote1: In the section "Query Terms" it notes:
{quote}
"If you combine multiple terms without specifying any Boolean operators, they will be joined using AND operators."
{quote}

Quote 2: In the "OR" operator section it notes a conflicting point:
{quote}
"The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used."
{quote}

Quote 1 States between 2 Terms a "AND" operator is used and Quote States between 2 terms a "OR" operator is used

Using the defined search criteria in the example of the documentation in the OR operator section, the second Quote is proven incorrect and the "AND" Operator is confirmed to be used instead of the "OR" operator as the Default conjunction operator.

h3. Environment
Cloud & Server Docs affected  Tested and verified behavior on Cloud and server version 7.2, 7.13, 8.0, & 8.2
- If using Jira cloud See corresponding Cloud Documentation inconsistency Report here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72541

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 issues 
#* Place "atlassian jira" in a text field on one issue (exe description)
#* Place "Confluence" on the second
#* Place "atlassian jira" and "confluence" on the third
# using the Example in the OR section search for:
{code}
"atlassian jira" OR confluence
{code}
# all three issues are returned
# Remove the "OR" operator to align with the statement "This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used."

h3. Expected Results
All three issues are returned

h3. Actual Results
Only the issue with both "atlassian jira" and "confluence" is returned as the AND operator is being used

h3. Suggested Correction Needed
NOTE: the Documentation error exists in all current versions 7.4 - 8.2 and also exists on legacy EOL version of the Server documentation, please review all versions for necessary corrections for Current and legacy documentation consistency.

Remove the notation under the "OR" operator section noting:
{quote}
The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used.
{quote}

Then under the "AND" operator section add in:
{quote}
The AND operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the AND operator is used.
{quote}
fields.summary: Incorrect information in Basic Search Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira returns incoherent search results. The problem manifests on Service Desk queues, Agile boards and issue search.

(!) At this stage, we believe *this is not a Jira bug* but a misuse of API. Jira API changed in version 8 and some add-ons don't properly use Jira API. 
The issue does not appears always and in every instance, even with the same add-ons installed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Service Desk queues
 ## Go to Service Desk project > Queues
 ## Go to one queue and observe the issue count
 ## Switch to another queue
 * Agile boards
 ## Go to an Agile board that contains swimlanes
 ## Move ticket from one swimlanes to another
 ## Observe the result
 * JQL search - issue list
 ## Open an issue list and apply JQL search
 ## Observe the number of returned results
 ## Keep refreshing the page and observe results

h3. Expected Results
 * Service Desk queues:
 ** Queues display correct and the same issue counts while navigating through queues
 * Agile boards:
 ** Moving tickets between swimlanes works as expected
 * Issue list:
 ** Issue list JQL search return the same results every time upon page refresh

h3. Actual Results
 * Service Desk queues
 ** Ticket count changes while “jumping” from one queue to another. Let’s say we have “Unassigned issues” queue with issue count 5; after focusing on “All open” issue queue, the number changes to 4
 * Agile boards
 ** When moving tickets from one swimlane to another, the ticket does not move (although its status has changed)
 * Issue lists:
 ** After applying JQL search, issue list showing different different number of results with each refresh

h3. Notes
Currently, on several instances, we noticed this behaviour being caused by one of the following add-ons:
 * [Eazy BI|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211051/eazybi-reports-and-charts-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=versions]
** upgrading the add-on to the latest version should resolve the issue
 * [Elements Copy & Sync|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211111/elements-copy-sync-formerly-exocet?hosting=server&tab=overview]
**  the fix was implemented in version 2.17.2
**  see the bug ticket for more information CS-1419:_ Inconsistent search results in Jira 8 with Copy & Sync_
 * [PII Protector for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215574/pii-protector-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=versions]
** No fix yet

h3. Probable cause
A plugin calls thread searcher context but never closes the context. Affected threads are using this old context which contains a snapshot of data from the time when this context was opened. As a result, the user observes issues "jumping" back and forth on boards, Service Desk queues and other issue lists.

h3. Workaround
Follow the workaround from [Inconsistent Search Results in Jira 8.X|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/inconsistent-search-results-in-jira-8-x-968673104.html]:
{panel}
To confirm if one of custom add-ons is causing the issue:
 # Stop Jira
 # Remove the add-on .jar file from <JIRA_HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins directory
 # Go to <JIRA_HOME>/plugins directory and remove the contents of .osgi-plugins and .bundled-plugins directory
 # Restart JIRA
 # Perform a full locked re-indexing
 # Check if the issue still appears
{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Incorrect version of Jira Software or Jira Service Desk is installed on top of Jira Core 8.2.3 via "Versions & licenses" panel.
* For Jira Software it will install version 8.2.4
* For Jira Service Desk it will install 4.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Jira Core 8.2.3
 # Go to ⚙️→ "Jira Administration" → "Applications"
 # In "Versions & licenses" ensure to have valid Jira Software license (can be trial)
 # Click "Install" button near "Jira Software"
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-19 at 14.19.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira Software version installed is 8.2.3

h3. Actual Results
Jira Software version installed is 8.2.4

h3. Workaround
*It's fine to leave Jira Software 8.2.4 and Jira Service Desk 4.2.4 with Jira Core 8.2.3.* However, we recommend to upgrade to Jira 8.2.4

It's possible to install the older version of application manually by downloading it from:
 * [Link for Jira Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213607/jira-software/version-history]
 * [Link for Jira Service Desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213632/jira-service-desk/version-history]
fields.summary: Adding Jira Service Desk or Jira Software via "Versions & licenses" panel in Jira 8.2.3 results in installation of application in higher version (4.2.4/8.2.4)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When configuring Jira to use SSO with third-party tools such as Jira SAML SSO using default group memberships, Jira does not populate its tables to include all related data to ensure that users can log in properly for the first time. Due to that, it is necessary to manually insert each user in the required group on Jira to ensure that they will be able to log in.


h3. Suggested Solution
Detect when an user tries to log in using SSO to include the necessary data in the *cwd* tables in the first login to ensure that he/she will receive the group membership properly and will be able to access Jira.
fields.summary: Ensure that Default Group Membership works with third-party SSO

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
German umlauts are not displayed correctly when using batch notifications and text notification format

 
h3. Environment
 * Jira 8.2.3


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Batch notifications
 # Change your user profile to get Text email notifications (away from default of HTML format)
 # Enable profile preferences to get notifications of own changes (makes it easier to test this, but changes made by other users would also test this too)
 # Create/edit an issue that has a summary that contains an umlaut character
 # wait to receive batched email notification

h3. Expected Results
All characters are represented correctly in the notification message

h3. Actual Results
If the summary contains special German characters, such as those with umlauts, they are replaced by the HTML code character value instead such as 
{noformat}ß   ü {noformat}
instead of the expected values of
{noformat}ß   ü{noformat}

example email received where this happens:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
SCRUM / SCRUM-26 [To Do]
HELLO WORLD ö ä ü ß test 12345

==============================

Here's what changed in this issue in the last few minutes.
This issue has been created

View or comment on issue using this link
http://localhost:8823/browse/SCRUM-26

==============================
 Issue created
------------------------------

admin created this issue on 17/Jul/19 3:10 PM
Summary:              HELLO WORLD ö ä ü ß test 12345
Issue Type:           Task
Assignee:             Unassigned
Created:              17/Jul/19 3:10 PM
Priority:             Low
Reporter:             admin
Description:          hi


==============================
 This message was sent by Atlassian Jira (v8.2.3#802003-sha1:5986657)
{code}

h3. Notes
Does not affect HTML notifications, nor does this appear to affect the other notifications outside the batched notifications


h3. Workaround
* You could turn off batched notifications to prevent this temporarily
* Or you could switch notifications to HTML format instead.
fields.summary: German letters such as umlauts are not displayed correctly when using batch notifications and text format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently if you *edit a comment* and this comment has a long table, then the horizontal scrollbar would only appear after scrolling the table to the very end:

[^longcomment.webm]
h3. Suggested Solution

Instead, the horizontal scrollbar should show the bar at the width of the comment box so users can scroll to the right without scrolling all the way down.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the horizontal scrollbar for a table to show at the size of the comment field

fields.description: For custom text fields, as an admin, I would like the option to put in an example text that is not the default value. Having an over-writable example (that does not save if the field is left empty) or having example text next to the field (like with time tracking) would help users more intuitively understand the nature of a field. This is especially useful for larger organizations.
fields.summary: Example text for custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, Jira uses QuickTime to embed videos on comments/descriptions. This works for Chrome and Firefox, but Safari has blocked the QuickTime plugin, which makes it so that embedded videos will not play on Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Jira on Safari.
# Upload a .mp4 video to an issue.
# Embed the video in a comment or issue using: 
{noformat}
!videoExample.mp4!
{noformat}
# Reload the page.

h3. Expected Results
Video will load and begin playing as soon as the page finishes loading.

h3. Actual Results
The video will not play, with a message showing {{Unsupported Plug-in}}.

h3. Workaround
There are multiple workarounds found around the web on how to re-enable QuickTime for Safari, but these no longer seem effective. Currently, we found no way of enabling this plugin on Safari.
fields.summary: Change Jira to use HTML5 for embedded videos instead of QuickTime

fields.description:
In the documentation for the [Manual upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-server-manual-938846939.html] there is a step that indicates the following:
{quote}h2. Extract the files
Extract the archive you've downloaded, and start the upgrade.
 # Extract (unzip) the files to a directory (this is your new installation directory, and must be different to your existing installation directory). 
 # Point Jira to your *existing* Jira home directory.{quote}
And in another line you have:
{quote}We recommend that you do it by setting the {{JIRA_HOME}} environment variable. For more info on how to do this, see [Setting Jira home directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-your-jira-application-home-directory-938847747.html].{quote}

For users that are unfamiliar with Jira, it may be better to change these instructions to be more explicit on *how* to point Jira to a Jira home directory, something like this:
{quote}h2. Extract the files
Extract the archive you've downloaded, and start the upgrade.
 # Extract (unzip) the files to a directory (this is your new installation directory, and must be different to your existing installation directory). 
 # Point Jira to your *existing* Jira home directory which in turn will allow it to connect to the existing database and upgrade the information in it. This can be done by either setting the {{JIRA_HOME}} environment variable or by modifying the jira-application.properties file. For more info on how to do this, see [Setting Jira home directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-your-jira-application-home-directory-938847747.html].{quote}
fields.summary: Improvement on installation documentation for Manual upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a table in the description field has several rows, instead of the table displaying in a clear way with scroll bar, the data is cramped together.
h3. Environment

Reproduced in Jira 8.2.2, 7.13.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table in the description field with several columns so that this flows out of the width of the description field

h3. Expected Results

The table should show as is with the scroll bar
h3. Actual Results

Scroll bar is missing and the table is cramped:
 !description.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * The scroll bar shows up correctly when editing the description field
 * The scroll appears both in the edit and view for the comment fields.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table in Jira issue description with over several columns causes table to be cramped

fields.description:
h3. Summary
From app vendor codebarrel:
{quote}
Steps:

# Setup Jira with bitbucket integration in in Jira server
# In your Jira workflow setup a trigger that automatically transitions the issue when a pull request is merged in Bitbucket
# Now setup an Automation for Jira rule, that is triggered on "Issue transitioned"
# Next merge a Pull request in Bitbucket with an issue linked to it in Jira.

Result:

The issue will be transitioned correctly through the workflow by the trigger

BUT - the automation rule will not execute, because Jira doesn't trigger a proper workflow transitioned event

See https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1448 for more details
{quote}

h3. Expected Results
Automatic triggers should fire a proper issue transitioned event in server

h3. Actual Results
Automatic triggers don't fire any issue transitioned event

h3. Notes
* Happens to all versions
* Impacting both Bitbucket Cloud and Github integrations

h3. Workaround
Setup an issue property updated trigger listening for changes to the automatic_transition_events_history property (will need Code Barrel's automation)
fields.summary: Automatic workflow triggers does not send an 'Issue transitioned event' in Jira server with DVCS integration
Support for Amazon Aurora Serverless Databases

fields.description:
Currently, there is no easy way to identify why a batch.js file is re-generated except some events like a new plugin install/update/removed. 

h4. Feature request

* As a Jira admin, I would like to find out whenever there is a new batch.js file is generated and why it was generated in Jira's log. This would help me to understand when a new batch.jb file needs to be downloaded by a user.
fields.summary: Add logging for batch.js changes

fields.description:
When looking at any specific version report, I want to be able to distinguish between scope creep and new bugs being created and added to the backlog (provided they have an estimate). It would also be interesting to have that distinction available on time spent.

 

!image-2019-07-15-16-07-13-035.png!
fields.summary: Version Report - distinguish between bugs and non-bugs

fields.description: When entering time on a ticket through the time tracking feature, there is a preview that gives an example of how time can be added using time units. The time display can be adjusted to only show certain values (like only hours) but the preview still shows all values. For organizations that have standardized time tracking for their employees, the preview can be confusing for users. We would like the option to remove or customize the preview to align with the expectations for the user entering the time.
fields.summary: Add option to hide time tracking example

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

robots.txt bundled in Jira is served with an incorrect MIME type which may impact the way search engines index and position instance's pages 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Visit JIRA_BASE_URL/robots.txt

h3. Expected results

The response's MIME type is text/plain
h3. Actual Results

Note that it's rendering as HTML (MIME type is text/html)
h3. Notes 

This behaviour is a result of changes introduced in Tomcat which was upgraded to version 8.5.40 in Jira 8.2.2. 
h3. Workaround

As robots.txt is a static file, Content-Type header for the response from accessing it can be easily overridden using e.g. a reverse proxy 

Currently no workaround based on altering e.g. web.xml or server.xml (Tomcat config files) is known. If one is discovered, it will be posted here.
fields.summary: robots.txt is served as text/html instead of text/plain

fields.description: I have a template issue (Task) with 43 sub-tasks. One of the great enhancements in JRIA 7.6 was the ability to sort sub-tasks on the parent issue by dragging and dropping. However, when I clone the parent issue, the cloned issue (a deep clone, including the sub-tasks) loses the sort order that had been applied to the sub-tasks on the original issue. This is something I do fairly regularly so it would be useful if the sub-task sort order could be preserved for the cloned issue.
fields.summary: Sort order of sub-tasks is lost when cloning the parent issue

fields.description: Due to the fact that keytool is not very comfortable and do not have a GUI for the system (Ubuntu server) Jira should a have a graphical tool to display and edit java keystore. For Windows we have programs like keystore explorer. It could be a welcome feature if jira have a tool like this.
fields.summary: Add a functionality to Jira to make it easier to import certificates for secure connection

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is currently not possible to link external JIRA issues from the edit or transition screen for eg https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-link-to-an-external-issue-on-a-transition-screen/qaq-p/880456

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement this feature. 
 
h3. Workaround

# Click issue from another instance via More > Create linked issue
# Create a link to an issue from another instance via View issue screen. This can be done by clicking the '+' on the Issue Links section.
fields.summary: Ability to link external JIRA issues on edit or transition screen

fields.description:
It seems that in certain installations of JDK/JRE, a certain file called libawt_xawt.so is required to work correctly; this file is included with the installation of xorg. In some cases, xorg will not be installed, and an error like the following may appear: {code}Loading application properties from /opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties
Reading database configuration from /var/atlassian/application-data/jira/dbconfig.xml
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /opt/atlassian/jira/jre/lib/amd64/libawt_xawt.so: libXrender.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1941)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1824)
at java.lang.Runtime.load0(Runtime.java:809)
at java.lang.System.load(System.java:1086)
at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1941)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1845)
at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:870)
at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:1122)
at java.awt.Toolkit$3.run(Toolkit.java:1636)
at java.awt.Toolkit$3.run(Toolkit.java:1634)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.awt.Toolkit.loadLibraries(Toolkit.java:1633)
at java.awt.Toolkit.<clinit>(Toolkit.java:1670)
at java.awt.Component.<clinit>(Component.java:593)
at com.atlassian.jira.configurator.Configurator.startGui(Configurator.java:56)
at com.atlassian.jira.configurator.Configurator.start(Configurator.java:38)
at com.atlassian.jira.configurator.Configurator.main(Configurator.java:32)
root@it-corp-ewr-jira1:/opt/atlassian/jira/bin#
{code}

The way to solve this is, as mentioned, to install xorg and this suggestion is to add this indication to the installation documentation, as there is no clear indication in the Atlassian docs at the moment.
fields.summary: Indicate that xorg is required to install Jira.
Installing Jira as a Service from service.bat on Windows will produce an unusable service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary From app developer: {quote} I'm trying to render html value of Jira fields like OrderableField field = fieldManager.getOrderableField("labels"); FieldLayoutItem fieldLayoutItem = fieldLayoutManager .getFieldLayout(issue) .getFieldLayoutItem(field); return field.getViewHtml(fieldLayoutItem, new FakeAction(ComponentAccessor.getJiraAuthenticationContext(), ComponentAccessor.getGlobalPermissionManager()), issue, MapBuilder.newBuilder("view_issue", true).toMutableMap() ); FakeAction is same as com.atlassian.jira.projects.issuenavigator.DefaultIssueRenderService.FakeAction And i've found that: labels field has invalid template. It's passing 'labels' in customFieldIdAsLong macro parameter, while the one used by jira in issue view is passing falseTemplate with issue: templates/jira/issue/field/labels-view.vmTemplate used for issue view: $jira-view-issue-plugin$/viewissue/fields/labels.vmBecause of this, label links have invalid url:
  • asd
  • saa
priority field doesn't render icon, while template for issue view does That's the ones i've found on first glance, maybe there's more.Maybe, there's a another method to render html field values, which doesn't include custom rendering logic on our side for each system field? {quote} h3. Environment AMPS and SDK are latest available, Jira 8.2.1 h3. Expected Results Fields are rendered like for issue view h3. Actual Results Fields are rendered differently, sometimes incorrectly h3. Notes - Templates are resolved correctly - There's an issue in template itself. In labels-view.vm: 'labels' is passed as 6th argument (customFieldIdAsLong) to labelsLozenges macro, and because of that, it's being rendered as custom field, instead of being rendered as system field. - The template in jira-view-issue plugin doesn't have such issue, and {{false}} is passed as customFieldIdAsLong macro arument. h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: in labels-view.vm, 'labels' passed as 6th argument (customFieldIdAsLong)  to labelsLozenges macro, thus being rendered as custom field, instead of system field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an Admin provided "Add Editors" in a dashboard to a group (Eg: test Group) and provided the same permission to a single user (Eg: Test User), if the Test User does not belong to Test Group, the user will not be able to edit the dashboard.


h3. Environment

* Jira 7.13.X
* Jira 8.2.X


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit a dashboard sharing configuration and provide "Add Editors" permission to a group and a single user.
# Ensure that the single user does not belong to the group.
# Login as the single user and check if you can edit the dashboard.


h3. Expected Results

The single user is able to edit the dashboard including the gadget.


h3. Actual Results

The single user is unable to edit the dashboard including the gadget.


h3. Workaround

# Add the user to the group which given the edit dashboard permission.
# Add a project where the user belongs to. This will allow the admin to set a role which the user belongs to.
fields.summary: Jira does not respect single user permission in Edit and Share Dashboard

fields.description:
Using the keyboard Up and Down arrows to navigate from one Issue to another in the Issue Navigator breaks if you transition or open any other dialog (such as assign / edit) you lose the ability to continue using the keyboard arrows as it will just scroll the issue list up and down instead of going to the next issue.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to the Issue Navigator in *Detail View* and use the Up and Down arrows of your keyboard to navigate from one issue to another.
# After moving a couple times try to assign one issue or transition it.
# The next time you use the arrows, you will not be able go from one issue to another, but the list will scroll up and down.

h3. Actual Results

Instead of keeping the functionality working the same way, we change the behavior after making a change in an issue.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to continue using the keyboard to navigate from one issue to another as previously.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts change behaviour in Issue Navigator after issue modification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Jira Admin visits the System Info Page /secure/admin/ViewSystemInfo.jspa

There exists a resource on this page that shows Jira's Java heap size and a link that allows you to "Force Garbage Collection'.  When trying to click this link in Jira 8.2.3 it does not work.
h3. Environment
 * Jira 8.2.3
 * Tested against multiple browsers, Firefox 67.0.4, Chrome 75.0.3770.100 same results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira as a system admin
 # Navigate to /secure/admin/ViewSystemInfo.jspa
 # Scroll down to {color:#172b4d}Java VM Memory Statistics{color}
 # Try to click the link for Force garbage collection

h3. Expected Results

Garbage collection is run against the heap.
h3. Actual Results
 # User gets an XRSF error page displayed
 # GC does not run
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-12 at 10.23.44 AM.png|thumbnail!
 # Logs show
{noformat}
2019-07-12 10:16:23,524 http-nio-8823-exec-15 INFO admin 616x2143x1 23zdgm 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ViewSystemInfo!garbageCollection.jspa [c.a.j.web.action.XsrfErrorAction] The security token is missing for 'admin'. The browser has provided ZERO parameters.  Probably BUG! User-Agent : 'Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.100 Safari/537.36'
{noformat}

h3. Notes

This works correctly in Jira 7.13
h3. Workaround
 * No way to work around this from within Jira itself.
 * However you could still force the JVM to perform a garbage collection event.  More details in [How to manually force a full garbage collection in Confluence - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-force-a-full-garbage-collection-in-confluence-943978676.html] (while this KB was created for Confluence, the steps can be applied to Jira in the same way)
fields.summary: When trying to force garbage collection in Jira ViewSystemInfo user gets XSRF Security Token Missing error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the share popup menu option is visible and being worked on, it sudden disappears when the issue view page is scrolled. This is particularly an issue in smaller screens or in the case when the browser size is small where scrolling is used more often. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue view page. 
# Click *Share* from the top right side of the page. 
# The share popup will appear, Type anything in the fields. 
# Scroll down.

h3. Expected Results
The page scrolls down, while the *Share* popup remain as it is.

h3. Actual Results
The *share* popup disappears. 

h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: Share popup disappears when the issue view page is being scrolled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA *randomly* throws {{ScrollIntoView.js}} and {{DefaultMessageOptions.js}} warnings in the logs, especially when *searching for issues* using Issue Navigator. This is reported to cause *slowness* in several cases.

h3. Environment
*JIRA 8.2.2 and 8.2.3* - *any browser* can trigger the issue.

*Not* reproducible in JIRA 8.2.1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
It's not possible to reproduce the issue at ease, but the following steps are known to trigger it:
# As user 1, access an Agile board and rank some issues
# Go to Issue Navigator by clicking Issues drop-down menu -> Search for issues
# Click Issues drop-down menu -> Current search
# As user 2, log in a different browser and repeat steps 1-3
# As user 3, log in a different browser and repeat steps 1-3
# Check {{JIRA_Home/log/atlassian-jira.log}}

h3. Expected Results
No JS warning about *{{com.atlassian.plugin.webresource}}* is thrown in the logs.

h3. Actual Results
These warnings may be thrown in the logs at any of the above replication steps, usually at steps 2-3:

h3. Issue Summary
We have a {{CalculatedCFType}} which uses Jira search API. It errors when re-index is triggered by {{devstatus}} threads.

We've seen such errors with these thread pools: {{devstatus.dvcs.github:thread-*}} and {{devstatus.applink:thread-*}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Call com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchProvider#search

The devstatus plugin runs tasks that re-index issues in non-jira threads with Jira thread local context

fields.summary: DevStatus plugin triggers issue reindex in non-Jira thread without JiraThreadLocalUtil/OffRequestThreadExecutor

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 31 August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

 

We have investigated the root cause of this bug and it appeared that it does not lay in Jira, but rather in Oracle driver, hence we closed it as Invalid.

To resolve the problem we advise to switch to Oracle jdbc driver 19.3 which is supported in jira 8.4+ versions.

For more details about root cause and other potential workarounds, please see this KB article ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-operations-may-fail-with-an-sql-exception-1018773564.html]) and this Oracle support article ([https://support.oracle.com/knowledge/Middleware/2184878_1.html]).

 

Cheers,
 Mateusz Ostaszewski
 Jira software developer
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Upgrading to Jira 7.13.4 and performing a clean install using our development database. created a new user and granted it the limited permissions as specified in the install instructions. When the database is being setup the following error is present in the atlassian-jira.log
{noformat}
2019-07-05 15:26:22,045 http-nio-8081-exec-12 ERROR anonymous 920x6x1 fah0iu 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/SetupDatabase.jspa [c.a.j.p.d.u.devsummary.migration.DevSummaryMigrationHandler] Error while upgrading rows.
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to enquire table names available in the system
{noformat}
this is followed by several java stack traces and one Oracle error, _"ORA-01427: single-row subquery returns more than one row."_
h3. Environment
 * Oracle Database
 * Existing production data

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Jira to an Oracle database with multiple schema
 # Upgrade Jira to any version after 7.6

h3. Expected Results

Jira upgrades to the later version and rewrites the information in the database as needed
h3. Actual Results

The upgrade fails. The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2019-07-05 15:26:22,045 http-nio-8081-exec-12 ERROR anonymous 920x6x1 fah0iu 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/SetupDatabase.jspa [c.a.j.p.d.u.devsummary.migration.DevSummaryMigrationHandler] Error while upgrading rows.
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to enquire table names available in the system
.........
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01427: single-row subquery returns more than one row
{noformat}
h3. Notes

In our database we have a type installed in another schema which shares the same name as an Oracle type. This is from an install of ESRI ArcGIS software in the database.

Jira is trying to get a list of all the table names for some reason. When it does this it is accessing the Oracle view ALL_TAB_COLS which returns all the columns of tables that the Jira user can see including those in other schemas. It's not limited to just the tables that Jira itself has created. I won't repeat the whole query shown in the log file but it can be simplified to the following.
{code:sql}
select t.owner, t.table_name, t.column_name, (select a.typecode from ALL_TYPES a where a.type_name = t.data_type) as data_type from ALL_TAB_COLS t;
{code}
In a default Oracle install that query will "work", but the query itself is poorly written. The type_name field is not a unique key for the ALL_TYPES table and the subquery will break as soon as you have the same type_name created in multiple schemas as we do. That query can be correctly written by adding a check for the owner to the subquery.
{code:sql}
select t.owner, t.table_name, t.column_name, (select a.typecode from ALL_TYPES a where a.type_name = t.data_type and a.owner = t.data_type_owner) as data_type from ALL_TAB_COLS t;
{code}
h3. Workaround

(untested)
 # Install Jira connected to an empty Oracle database
 # Move the data over as described in [Switching Databases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/switching-databases-938846867.html]
 # Complete setup
fields.summary: Cannot Upgrade Jira connected to an Oracle database due to a query in the installer
